meanings.definition: Presenting something for discussion or consideration.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah will be tabling her proposal for a new project.
meanings.sent2: The team will be tabling various ideas for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: John surprised everyone by tabling his suggestion for a team outing to the zoo.
meanings.sent4: By tabling her innovative plan, Emily sparked a lively debate among the group.
meanings.sent5: Tabling his argument with confidence, Mark captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Postponing or shelving something for later.
meanings.sent1: Due to time constraints, the decision on the budget was tabling until next week.
meanings.sent2: The project was tabling temporarily to focus on more urgent tasks.
meanings.sent3: The team ended up tabling the discussion about office renovations for another day.
meanings.sent4: By tabling the issue, they bought themselves more time to gather additional information.
meanings.sent5: Tabling the decision allowed for further reflection and analysis.

meanings.definition: Arranging information in a table format.
meanings.sent1: She was tabling the data to compare sales figures from the past three months.
meanings.sent2: The report required tabling the results in a clear and organized manner.
meanings.sent3: He spent hours tabling the survey responses into a comprehensive chart.
meanings.sent4: By tabling the information, it became easier to identify trends and patterns.
meanings.sent5: Tabling the statistics visually enhanced the understanding of the data.
